IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES AFFORDABLE HOUSING SOLUTIONS BY CONSTRUCTING NEW HOUSES AND REVITALIZING EXISTING HOUSES. THEY ENCOURAGE FAMILY STABILITY AND PROMOTE SELF SUFFICIENCY, EDUCATIONAL ACHIEVEMENT AND RESPONSIBLE CITIZENSHIP WHILE SEEKING TO ELIMINATE POVERTY HOUSING.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES AFFORDABLE HOUSING SOLUTIONS BY CONSTRUCTING NEW HOUSES AND REVITALIZING EXISTING HOUSES. THEY ENCOURAGE FAMILY STABILITY AND PROMOTE SELF SUFFICIENCY, EDUCATIONAL ACHIEVEMENT AND RESPONSIBLE CITIZENSHIP WHILE SEEKING TO ELIMINATE POVERTY HOUSING.
IRS990.Desc: THE ORGANIZATION CONSTRUCTED 25 HOMES DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 2018. AT THE END OF THE YEAR 53 HOMES WERE IN PROCESS. IN ADDITION, THE ORGANIZATION PERFORMED CRITICAL REPAIRS ON 83 OWNER OCCUPIED HOUSES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE RESTORE IS A DISCOUNT HOME IMPROVEMENT CENTER THAT SELLS NEW AND USED HOME IMPROVEMENT ITEMS TO THE PUBLIC AND FUNDS ARE USED TO PROVIDE AFFORDABLE HOUSING SOLUTIONS. IN ADDITION, THE RESTORE FURTHERS THE HABITAT MISSION BY ALLOWING FAMILIES WHO DO NOT HAVE THE FUNDS TO AFFORD TYPICAL REHAB OPPORTUNITIES TO BE ABLE TO FIX UP THEIR OWN HOMES AND HAS AN ENVIRONMENTAL COMPONENT BY KEEPING ITEMS THAT WOULD TYICALLY END UP IN A LANDFILL IN USE. OUR PARTNER FAMILIES ARE REQUIRED TO SERVE IN THE RESTORE TO LEARN VALUABLE SKILLS ABOUT CUSTOMER SERVICE AND HOME REPAIR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TAX POSITIONS ARE INITIALLY RECOGNIZED IN THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS WHEN IT IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT THE POSITION WILL BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY THE TAX AUTHORITIES. THE ORGANIZATION HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT QUALIFY FOR EITHER RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE IN THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AS OF JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017 BASED ON AN ASSESSMENT OF MANY FACTORS INCLUDING EXPERIENCE AND INTERPRETATIONS OF TAX LAWS APPLIED TO THE FACTS OF EACH MATTER FOR ALL OPEN TAX YEARS.
DIRECT FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 9,392. COST OF GOODS SOLD RELATED TO SALE OF INVENTORY 958,349. RENTAL EXPENSES 173,721. CENTRAL ALABAMA HOUSING ALLIANCE 195.
DIRECT FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 9,392. COST OF GOODS SOLD RELATED TO SALE OF INVENTORY 958,349. RENTAL EXPENSES 173,721. CENTRAL ALABAMA HOUSING ALLIANCE 11,723.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: TO AIDE THE ORGANIZATION'S EXEMPT PURPOSE

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: UPON COMPLETION OF THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 990, THE RETURN IS REVIEWED BY SENIOR MANAGEMENT FOR ACCURACY AND COMPLETENESS. ONCE THE SENIOR MANAGEMENT HAS REVIEWED AND APPROVED THE FORM 990, THE RETURN IS SENT TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW. THE FORM 990 IS THEN EMAILED TO DIRECTORS AND POSTED TO THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE FOR ACCESS BY DIRECTORS AND THE PUBLIC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CEO AND KEY STAFF REGULARLY AND CONSISTENTLY MONITOR THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY TO ENSURE NO ACTUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS. IN THE CASE OF POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST, MULTIPLE BIDS ARE REQUIRED AND THE POTENTIALLY INTERESTED PARTY DOES NOT HAVE ANY INVOLVEMENT IN THE AWARDING OF BIDS. FULL DISCLOSURE IS MADE TO THOSE MAKING THE DECISION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, UNDER DIRECTION OF THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, ANNUALLY REVIEWS THE COMPENSATION FOR THE ORGANIZATIONS CEO AND APPROVES ANY CHANGES OR ADJUSTMENTS. THE CEO ALSO REVIEWS ANNUALLY THE COMPENSATION FOR OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES OF THE ORGANIZATION AND APPROVES ANY CHANGES OR ADJUSTMENTS WITHIN THE RANGE PERMITTED BY THE ANNUAL BUDGET. THE ANNUAL BUDGET IS APPROVED BY THE BOARD AS A WHOLE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SECTION 1.263(A)-1(F) DE MINIMIS SAFE HARBOR ELECTION
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GREATER BIRMINGHAM HABITAT FOR HUMANITY, INC. P.O. BOX 540 FAIRFIELD, AL 35064 EMPLOYER IDENTIFICATION NUMBER: 63-0962910 FOR THE YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 2018 GREATER BIRMINGHAM HABITAT FOR HUMANITY, INC. IS MAKING THE DE MINIMIS SAFE HARBOR ELECTION UNDER REG. SEC. 1.263(A)-1(F).
THE ORGANIZATION ENGAGES AN INDEPENDENT CPA FIRM TO AUDIT ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ON A YEARLY BASIS.

IdDisregardedEntitiesGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: HOLDING OF MORTGAGE LOANS AND RELATED DOCUMENTS

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: TO PROVIDE QUALITY, SAFE, AFFORDABLE HOUSING TO LOWER INCOME RESIDENTS
